channel.title: Project Insanity help please
channel.description:
I would like to know how to change NPC names and Item names. Also, I would like to know how to change what it reads when you click examine on an Item/NPC. Thanks.
~ Reverse Hate

item.title: Project Insanity help please
item.dc:creator: @concript concript
item.description:
@concript wrote:

Reverse Hate:

How would I change that? I’m kinda new to coding. I’m still messing around on 317’s.

Just add me on skype, ferat.mad and i will help u.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity help please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Reverse Hate, post:5, topic:429742”]EntityDef.java:59: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable entityDef
location: class EntityDef
entityDef.name = “Test NPC”; //Npc name
^
EntityDef.java:60: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable entityDef
location: class EntityDef
entityDef.description = “Test Desription”.getBytes(); //Npc description
^
Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

Any Ideas??[/quote]

You don’t have a variable “entityDef” in the current scope.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity help please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Reverse Hate:

I did that but I got some errors. 17 to be exact, What did I do wrong? I did just as you said.

If your client isn’t renamed, then it would cause errors.

Try posting the errors, and perhaps people would have an easier time helping.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Insanity help please
item.dc:creator: @concript concript
item.description:
@concript wrote:

Thats client sided for a npc,
go to entitydef.java
and add this after:

	entityDef.readValues(stream);



	if (i == ####) { //Npc id
		entityDef.name = "NPCNAME"; //Npc name
		entityDef.description = "NpcDescription".getBytes(); //Npc description
	}

for items, its just the same only in itemdef or itemdef2
use another code.

Read full topic
